awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase I: Interest-Based Learning Management System to Ensure University Students are Qualified to Gain Web3 Careers
awd_abstract_narration:
This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project empowers post-secondary students, especially those from Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) and Minority Serving Institutions (MSIs), to seize lucrative opportunities in the rapidly growing blockchain job market, which currently faces the trend of outsourcing. Blockchain-related careers are among the most sought-after professions of the future, yet many students lack clarity regarding the blockchain career paths suitable for their interests and abilities. This career assessment technology will bridge this knowledge gap, enhancing students' understanding of various career possibilities within the blockchain industry. By doing so, the technology aligns with the needs of both businesses and educational institutions while contributing to the national welfare by facilitating the entry of young adults into high-paying careers. This project offers a unique career matching platform that guides students from diverse academic backgrounds, including both technical and non-technical majors, toward highly skilled blockchain positions. 

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project seeks to address the shortage of a skilled blockchain technology workforce in the United States, which has resulted in the outsourcing of blockchain-related jobs to other countries. The primary research objectives involve quantifying the relationship between an individual's interests and their potential suitability for blockchain-related employment while offering versatile career path recommendations. This project examines key career attributes such as creativity, risk-taking propensity, and analytical skills, aiming to identify correlations with potential blockchain roles. The research will explore the hobbies and interests of current blockchain professionals and establish a mathematical formula that aligns attributes with various job titles, as reported by hiring managers. Field testing will be conducted at HBCUs and MSIs to validate the effectiveness of the formulas and scoring system, ultimately recommending suitable web3 blockchain job titles to students.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
The DeFi All Odds Career Assessment platform represents a significant advancement in career guidance for students aspiring to enter the Web3 industry. Inspired by the curiosity and enthusiasm of Historically Black College and University students, our team was driven to create an innovative tool that bridges the gap between students' interests/hobbies and emerging Web3 careers. This tool addresses the unique challenges of the Web3 space, including the lack of applicants and the need for adaptable, real-time recommendations that do not rely on prior technical skills or personality tests, or require past skills, but rather, help more students enter this industry. For example, asking if someone likes karaoke may imply they have an ear for music. It follows, then, that an ear for music indicates they can process information conducive to learning different languages. This, in turn, could translate to success with coding languages as a Blockchain Software Developer. Additionally, HBCUs and other MSIs now have access to a tool to bring awareness to this industry and increase blockchain knowledge and internship experience so their students can qualify for some of the highest-paying careers in the world.

Defi All Odds Student Assessment Results: Throughout Phase I, we conducted extensive research and data collection, engaging with over 7,000 Web3 professionals and hundreds of students. The results indicate positive feedback from the students regarding their job title recommendations. 100% of the students liked at least one job title. Further examination of the data shows that in terms of job titles, 46.7% of students liked three job titles or more, 15.5% of students liked two job titles, and 38.7% of students liked one job title.

Before the assessment, students generally reported limited knowledge of Web3 careers. After the assessment, post-assessment ratings indicated a significant increase of 78.3% in students' knowledge and understanding of Web3 careers. The 78.3% increase in knowledge ratings suggests that the assessment itself was also effective in educating students about Web3 careers. The assessment process not only helped students identify suitable job functions and titles but also enhanced their overall awareness and preparedness for careers in the Web3 sector. This dual benefit underscores the value of incorporating such assessments into career development programs overall.

Specifically, positive student feedback highlights this impact by noting that DeFi All Odds increased their knowledge of Web3 and their confidence, as well as opened their eyes to new career opportunities they had not previously considered. One student stated that DeFi All Odds made them realize how their skills could fit into the Web3 industry. This type of feedback reflects the positive impact the assessment had on students, highlighting the importance of such tools in career education and development.

In conclusion, the DeFi All Odds Career Assessment platform exemplifies the innovative spirit of Crypto Tutors, combining advanced statistical methods with a user-centric design to create a powerful tool for career guidance. By leveraging the strengths of our proprietary statistical methods and prompt engineering, we developed a system that not only meets the needs of today's students but also paves the way for future advancements in Web3 career assessment and guidance.

 

 


Last Modified: 08/09/2024
Modified by: Nina Blankenship
